instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2849: What is 820-2849? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead after gpu replace
threads.message:
hello group.

after gpu replacment not able to turn on that board.

missing <SIGNAL>PPCPUVTT_S0</SIGNAL>

need some help, <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> replaced already, problem still the same

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead after gpu replace
threads.message:
by heating the CPU the value <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> pin 4/5 goes down to 6 Ohm.

Is it needfull to reflow the CPU or to reball?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead after gpu replace
threads.message: Remove GPU and see if it works again...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead after gpu replace
threads.message: removed GPU now but same results :-(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead after gpu replace
threads.message: I see nothing wrong with the values around <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>. Was this working before you touched the GPU? What is resistance to GND on L7630?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead after gpu replace
threads.message:
No Title

yes it was working bbefore i touched the gpu. it had problems when heavy working grafical things on the external gpu, internal no problems.

resistance to GND on L7630 is 16.6 Ohm, red on ground in diode mode i get 0.020

i pulled out L7630 now and injecting 1.05V into pin2 of L7630 and in that moment the voltages brakes down (GPU pic1 is sinking down slowly) the lab power supply shows 1.2A and voltage breaks down to 0.7V

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is not breaking down

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead after gpu replace
threads.message: I have no idea, 16 Ohm is not too low. Signals around <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> look ok. I have no idea other than you fried it by heating everything too much.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2849</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> dead after gpu replace
threads.message:
hmmm. I used the same thermo profile like over years without problems.

so do you can explain why the voltages are going to zero by injecting 1.05V ?

can here be a problem with cracks under <CHIP>U1800</CHIP>? <SIGNAL>PPCPUVTT_S0</SIGNAL> is connected with <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_PCH</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPVTT_S0_PCH</SIGNAL> ?

when injecting the 1.05V into Pin2 L7630 only the S0 and S3 Rails going down to zero,

S5 rails,
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>,
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_CPU_IMVP_ISNS</SIGNAL> and
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>

not going down to zero.
